item.title: Bermuda to host 2017 America's Cup
item.description: Bermuda, with its stunning backdrop of crystal clear waters and pink sands, will host the world's greatest sailing race, the America's Cup, in 2017, organisers announced Tuesday.

item.title: Miami Dolphins rally to beat struggling New York Jets
item.description: Caleb Sturgis kicked the go-ahead field goal with just under two minutes left as the Miami Dolphins rallied for a 16-13 NFL win over the last-place New York Jets.

item.title: Hapless Philadelphia 76ers drop to 0-17
item.description: Kawhi Leonard tallied 26 points and 10 rebounds to lead the San Antonio Spurs to a 109-103 win over the Philadelphia 76ers, who moved one step closer to infamy.

item.title: NFL players in Ferguson show of support
item.description: Five NFL players for the St Louis Rams entered the field Sunday with their arms raised in the "hands up, don't shoot" gesture of protesters demanding justice for black teenager Michael Brown.

item.title: Thierry Henry confirms New York exit, leaves options open
item.description: French striker Thierry Henry has played his last game for the New York Red Bulls after four and a half years at the club, he announced on their website on Monday.

item.title: Red-hot Rodgers outshines Brady in QB showdown
item.description: Quarterback Aaron Rodgers delivered a precision passing game as the Green Bay Packers remained perfect at home with a 26-21 victory over Tom Brady's New England Patriots on Sunday.

item.title: Crawford keeps lightweight crown
item.description: Terence Crawford retained his World Boxing Organization lightweight title and kept his undefeated record intact with a unanimous decision over the number one contender Ray Beltran on Saturday.

item.title: Spieth 'very far away' from top of golf's world ranking
item.description: Rising star Jordan Spieth obliterated world number one Rory McIlroy by 15 strokes in his runaway Australian Open triumph, but says he is "very far away" from becoming the top-ranked player.

item.title: Raptors' DeRozan out with groin injury
item.description: The Toronto Raptors' leading scorer DeMar DeRozan will be out indefinitely after suffering a groin injury in Friday's National Basketball Association game against Dallas.

item.title: Singapore need Serena lift at tennis league debut
item.description: World number one Serena Williams is being called upon to do the heavy lifting and rescue her struggling Singapore Slammers team at the inaugural International Premier Tennis League tournament.

item.title: 76ers inch closer to dubious distinction
item.description: Tyson Chandler had 20 points, 13 rebounds and four steals as the Dallas Mavericks defeated Philadelphia 110-103, sending the struggling 76ers to their 16th straight loss on Saturday.
